alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 31 at 2:57PM AKDT until June 01 at 10:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Rain transitioning to snow before midnight. Snow accumulations around 1 to 2 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin, mainly through the higher elevations of the Richardson, Glenn, and Tok Cutoff Highways. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 10 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Another round of unseasonably late snowfall is anticipated later tonight through tomorrow morning. Forecast temperatures tonight should be slightly cooler than what was experienced earlier on Wednesday. Thus, amounts of 1 to 2 inches of snow are expected, specifically along the Glenn Highway from east of Eureka to just west of Glennallen. Additional accumulations of 1 to 2 inches of snow are possible along the Richardson Hwy from Glennallen northward along the Richardson Highway to Paxson into Isabel Pass, as well as along the Tok Cutoff Highway to Mentasta Lake. Due to the temperatures being just cold enough for snow, snow accumulations could be either more than expected or stay mostly rain in some parts of the Copper River Basin.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
